final_output_text: Based on the information found, the most surprising part of this study seems to be that the only difference observed between men and women with severe COVID-19 was that the procalcitonin (inflammation index) was higher in men compared to women. This was a relatively small and specific difference, which may have been unexpected given the broader health impacts of COVID-19. The study did not find any other major sex-based differences in the clinical or laboratory parameters examined.
